column4: Ok next question. My desktop thinks it has a laptop display. It is in 1024x768 (4:3) How do I loose the 4:3?
that doesn't make sense, what is the native resolution of your monitor?
if the native resolution of your monitor is 1024x768 and your currently running at 1024x768, and that is a 4:3 resolution, then I don't see the problem
It has everything bloated likes it 800x600
4:3 simply means that given a pixel, there are 4 pixels horizontally for every 3 pixels vertically
what version are you on?
upgrade to what?
do you need to install proprietary drivers?
what desktop are you using?
if you could fit 12, then you did something special
but what we are trying to tell you is that is isn't
you are just used to stuff being super small
if you want to make things smaller again, you'll probably want to lookup how to change the DPI
http://www.upubuntu.com/2012/05/how-to-change-font-and-ui-user.html
open up jockey and see if it says it's using the proprietary drivers
pastebin the output of 'jockey-text -l'
right click should work, or use pastebinit
then use pastebinit
yes, it's a program that will put it to pastebin for you
yea that looks ok, providing your card is supported by nvidia current (which it should be). Have you tried going into nvidia-settings and changing the resolution there?
run nvidia-settings (probably with gksudo) and look at the xserver display configuration
that isn't odd, that is how the drivers work
which is exactly why I was trying to find out if you were using the correct driver
